intro: Erigeron caespitosus var. grandiflorus, commonly known as the blueweed or blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a perennial herb characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and silvery-blue foliage. The plant produces showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, blooming from late spring to early fall. It thrives in moist to wet soils and is often found in marshes, swales, and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in wetland gardens.
